typeSystemDescription.name: OpenNLP Example Types
typeSystemDescription.description: Type system used by the org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp package. Defines token, sentence, named entity, and syntactic parse annotation types.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.Clause
typeDescription.description: Clause level syntactic parse annotation.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.Phrase
typeDescription.description: Phrase level syntactic annotation.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.SyntaxAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Syntax annotation, typically created by a parser.

featureDescription.name: componentId
featureDescription.description: Identifier of the annotator that created this annotation.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.S
typeDescription.description: Simple declarative clause, i.e. one that is not introduced by a (possible empty) subordinating conjunction or a wh-word and that does not exhibit subject-verb inversion.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.SBAR
typeDescription.description: Clause introduced by a (possibly empty) subordinating conjunction.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.SBARQ
typeDescription.description: Direct question introduced by a wh-word or a wh-phrase. Indirect questions and relative clauses should be bracketed as SBAR, not SBARQ.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.SINV
typeDescription.description: Inverted declarative sentence, i.e. one in which the subject follows the tensed verb or modal.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.SQ
typeDescription.description: Inverted yes/no question, or main clause of a wh-question, following the wh-phrase in SBARQ.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.ADJP
typeDescription.description: Adjective Phrase.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.ADVP
typeDescription.description: Adverb Phrase.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.CONJP
typeDescription.description: Conjunction Phrase.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.FRAG
typeDescription.description: Fragment.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.INTJ
typeDescription.description: Interjection. Corresponds approximately to the part-of-speech tag UH.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.LST
typeDescription.description: List marker. Includes surrounding punctuation.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.NAC
typeDescription.description: Not a Constituent; used to show the scope of certain prenominal modifiers within an NP.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.NP
typeDescription.description: Noun Phrase.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.NX
typeDescription.description: Used within certain complex NPs to mark the head of the NP. Corresponds very roughly to N-bar level but used quite differently.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.PP
typeDescription.description: Prepositional Phrase.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.PRNphrase
typeDescription.description: Parenthetical.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.PRT
typeDescription.description: Particle. Category for words that should be tagged RP.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.QP
typeDescription.description: Quantifier Phrase (i.e. complex measure/amount phrase); used within NP.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.RRC
typeDescription.description: Reduced Relative Clause.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.UCP
typeDescription.description: Unlike Coordinated Phrase.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.VP
typeDescription.description: Vereb Phrase.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.WHADJP
typeDescription.description: Wh-adjective Phrase. Adjectival phrase containing a wh-adverb, as in how hot.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.WHAVP
typeDescription.description: Wh-adverb Phrase. Introduces a clause with an NP gap. May be null (containing the 0 complementizer) or lexical, containing a wh-adverb such as how or why.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.WHNP
typeDescription.description: Wh-noun Phrase. Introduces a clause with an NP gap. May be null (containing the 0 complementizer) or lexical, containing some wh-word, e.g. who, which book, whose daughter, none of which, or how many leopards.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.WHPP
typeDescription.description: Wh-prepositional Phrase. Prepositional phrase containing a wh-noun phrase (such as of which or by whose authority) that either introduces a PP gap or is contained by a WHNP.

typeDescription.name: org.apache.uima.examples.opennlp.X
typeDescription.description: Unknown, uncertain, or unbracketable. X is often used for bracketing typos and in bracketing the...the-constructions.
